Skenes is the first pitcher in the Modern Era with 150 strikeouts and an ERA under 2.00 in his first 22 career games.
Paul Skenes became just the second player since 1913 to post a sub-2.00 ERA through 22 career appearances.

Paul Skenes is the only pitcher in baseball history to have a sub-2.20 ERA and 150-plus strikeouts in his first 21 games.
Paul Skenes upped his strikeout total to 167 on the year, the fifth-most by a pitcher in their first 22 appearances since 2001.
Paul Skenes recorded his 16th game with seven or more strikeouts, surpassing Larry McWilliams (1983) for seventh-most by a Pirates starter in a season.
